get.description: This API endpoint retrieves a specific entity by its unique ID from the database. The response includes details about the entity in JSON format.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the entity

404.description: Entity not found

get.description: This endpoint retrieves all entities from the database, returned as a list in JSON format.
This API retrieves entities based on their natural source. The results are returned in JSON format.

parameters.name: naturalSource
parameters.description: Natural source of the entities

404.description: No entities found

get.description: Provides autocomplete suggestions for entity names based on a partial input. Results are in JSON format.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Partial input for entity search

get.description: Retrieves all molecules available in the database, returned as a JSON list.

get.summary: Gets a molecule by PubChem ID
get.description: Retrieves a specific molecule by its PubChem ID. The response includes detailed information in JSON format.

parameters.name: pubChemId
parameters.description: PubChem ID of the molecule

404.description: Molecule not found

get.description: Retrieves a molecule by its name. The response includes molecule details in JSON format.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the molecule

404.description: Molecule not found

get.description: Performs a detailed search for a molecule based on various parameters and returns the result in JSON format.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Search query for finding molecules

get.description: Provides autocomplete suggestions for molecule names based on a partial input. Results are in JSON format.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Partial input for molecule search

get.summary: Gets the molecule of the day
get.description: Retrieves the molecule of the day, including detailed information in JSON format.

404.description: Molecule of the day not found

get.description: Retrieves all receptors available in the database, returned as a JSON list.

404.description: No receptors found

get.description: Retrieves a specific receptor by its unique ID. The response includes detailed information in JSON format.

parameters.name: receptor_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the receptor

404.description: Receptor not found

get.description: Retrieves a specific receptor by its name. The response includes detailed information in JSON format.

parameters.name: receptor_name
parameters.description: Name of the receptor

404.description: Receptor not found

get.summary: Gets entities by name and category
get.description: Retrieves entities based on their alias and category using query parameters. The results are returned in JSON format.

parameters.name: entity_alias
parameters.description: Alias of the entity

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category of the entity

404.description: No entities found

get.summary: Gets entities by natural source (Query Parameter)
get.description: Retrieves entities based on their natural source using a query parameter. The results are returned in JSON format.

parameters.name: natural_source_name
parameters.description: Natural source of the entities

404.description: No entities found

get.description: Fetches an entity based on its readable alias using a query parameter. The response is returned in JSON format.

parameters.name: entity_alias_readable
parameters.description: The readable alias of the entity to fetch

404.description: Entity not found

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: For accessing the API, a valid JWT token must be passed in all queries in the 'Authorization' header. The token must be prefixed by the word 'Bearer' followed by a space. The token is generated by the API. Here is an example of how the Authorization header should appear: Bearer <API_KEY>
